newsitem.title: ALBANIA: SOCCER-ALBANIA SQUAD FORCED TO MEET IN PORTUGAL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ALBANIA SQUAD FORCED TO MEET IN PORTUGAL.

text.p: Albania's World Cup squad will assemble abroad ahead of Saturday's qualifier in Portugal because of continuing unrest in the Balkan country.
Team official Gjergj Thaka said on Monday that coach Astrit Hafizi and six home-based players would join 12 exiles in Oporto, Portugal.
"The coach does not aim at achieving any result but to present the team with dignity, taking into consideration our difficult circumstances," said Thaka.

Albania has been in a turbulent state since riots sparked by the collapse of pyramid investment schemes forced President Sali Berisha to instal a government of national reconciliation and agree to early elections.
Thaka said the squad would be missing Germany-based forward Altin Rraklli because of injury.
"Lack of training for the domestic players obliged Hafizi to call many players from Cyprus, Greece, Germany, Croatia, Malta and Portugal," Thaka said.
Albania's main soccer league has not beein in action since late January because of the internal problems.
The Albanian senior and under-21 teams played their last matches against Ukraine and Germany in Spain after political violence forced the games to be moved from home venues.
Defenders - Ilir Shulku, Afrim Tole, Artan Vila, Rudi Vata, Arjan Xhumba, Zamir Shpuza, Fatos Daja.
Midfielders - Sokol Prenga, Salvador Kacaj, Bledar Kola, Altin Haxhi, Amarildo Zela.
Forwards - Alban Bushi, Igli Tare, Fatmir Vata, Eduard Abazi.
